fields.description:
Hi,

The release/ versioning part of Next- Gen projects does not function to the same extent as a classic project. The Company needs to be able to see what releases issues are in as a label like on issues in the backlog, like the epic. I have hundreds of issues having to click inside each issue to see the release is a massive waste of time, to the point that the whole release function in Next- Gen is useless. This also needs to show on issues on the board.

I would love to get a reply to say this will be done soon. So many tickets on here take years to get done and it makes no sense that this functionality is not part of Next- gen. It makes life harder.
fields.summary: Release Next- Gen Backlog and board label

 !image-2020-09-11-10-26-41-745.png|thumbnail!

Add the same information on the Next-gen Burndown report.

fields.description:
Hello Team,

 

Really a welcome step showing the basic roadmap for the projects.

Please let us know if this is can be done and when.

Note - portfolio roadmap* for JIRA

fields.description: As a Jira user I would like to be able to see the sprint burndown report by time estimation. This would allow the team to see their progress in the sprint during standup on a day to day basis. The added value comes from how story points may not necessarily close day to day and result in most sprint burn down reports by story having step curves near the end of the sprint and thus offer little value. The report burning by time delivers value and insight sooner and more often!

It is common that multiple JIRA issues will be incorporated into 1 Bitbucket branch.

In a Next-gen board if you delete all your columns and you leave only one when trying to add new columns a generic error is displayed

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Try to add a new column with the add column icon

A video with an example: https://share.getcloudapp.com/L1uJl1ob
 

h3. Expected Results
A new column is added.

h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed and the column is not created.

h3. Workaround

Create a new Next-gen project and move your issues to it, it seems that this BUG is not triggered if more than 1 column is present.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "*comment"* field into the "*Transition screen*" appears with the old issue view render, even when we're using the new issue view.
 * If we format the comment will appear the markdown code as follows below:
{code:java}
{color:red}test{color}
{code}
  !image-2020-09-08-17-05-18-815.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to be able to configure different teams for different scenarios

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the {{sprint.isStarted}} or the {{issue.Sprint.isStarted}} smart values, only false is ever returned for a valid sprint. No value is returned for "none" as the sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation in a Jira Software project that triggers on change of the sprint for the issue.
 # set an action to send an email to yourself with the body containing the {{sprint.isStarted}} value (for debugging)
 # apply an advanced compare operation to check if the {{sprint.isStarted}} value is ever equal to "true" and some action after that such as a comment to the issue to see if the condition passed.
 # Save the automation and activate it.
 # create a sprint, add an issue to that sprint.
 # start the sprint, add another issue to the sprint.

h3. Expected Results
 At least one of the above issues returns "true" for the isStarted value and the automation is able to perform the correct action.

h3. Actual Results

The automation only ever returns false, so the automation cannot run as expected.

h3. Workaround

There is currently no known workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: sprint isStarted smart value only ever returns false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62636].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When using a touchscreen as an input device, touch/gesture responses are inconsistent and/or behave in an unexpected way when navigating Agile Boards.

(i) The issue has best reproducibility and visibility on a largely populated board with many issues and columns which cause the board to not fit in browser view, necessitating scrolling to see the whole board.

(off) Using a Windows 10 laptop with touchscreen capabilities, on Google Chrome 53.0.2785.116 m:

Rapidly swiping across the screen when starting the swipe in blank space will scroll the page, allowing the user to navigate to offscreen portions of the board. This is expected.

Rapidly swiping across the screen when starting the swipe on an issue will pick the issue up and proceed with moving it around the board, which is *unexpected*. The effect of this is that largely populated boards can become difficult and unintuitive to scroll through.

(on) Using the same laptop on Firefox instead:

Rapidly swiping across the screen when starting the swipe in blank space will scroll the page, allowing the user to navigate to offscreen portions of the board. This is expected.

Rapidly swiping across the screen when starting the swipe on an issue will still scroll the page, allowing the user to navigate to offscreen portions of the board. This is expected.

h3. Suggested Solution

Normalize the behavior from within the application to match what is expected and happens in Firefox. It's desired that swipes scroll a page, and prolonged holds and then drags can perform a drag and drop instead. 

Consider revising JIRA's Supported Platforms documentations to be more explicit about using touchscreens as an input device, as well as Mobile versions of the standard supported browsers.

h3. Workaround 
Consider using a different browser, which may offer different behaviors when it comes to touchscreen behaviors.
fields.summary: Implement consistent touchscreen behavior on Agile Boards in Chrome

h3. Issue Summary

The Portfolio 2.0 view shows some strange values and characters in the progress bar view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira classic project and create 1 epic and some stories
 # Link the stories to the Epic
 # Complete at least one of the stories
 # Create an Advanced Roadmaps plan using the project created in step #1 as the issue source
 # Access the plan and click *Settings > Configure > Planning interface* and click on *Disable improved interface*
 # Go back to the plan and click the progress bar next to the epic

h3. Expected Results

The progress bar is displayed properly and it shows the details about the completion of the stories linked to the Epic.
h3. Actual Results

Some strange values like {{sBumpDependencyVersionsEnabled()}} are displayed

!Screen Shot 2020-09-04 at 4.59.20 PM.png|width=509,height=262!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Portfolio 2.0 view shows some strange values and characters in the progress bar view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using GitHub app or Bitbucket integration along with workflow triggers, the workflow transitions are shown as performed by Anonymous users
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect your Project with the GitHub app. 
 # Configure your Workflow triggers such as that for PullRequestCreated or PullRequestMerged, which transitions your issue accordingly.

h3. Expected Results

The user account who has performed the changes in the Git environment is mapped here on the Issue history
h3. Actual Results

The issue history for the transitions, mention that this was performed by an anonymous user.
 !Screenshot 2020-09-05 at 1.01.27 AM.png|thumbnail! 

This is despite confirming that the smart commit operation using 
{code:java}
[Issue-Key]#comment TestComment 
{code}
, here the comments are created with the correct user name – that is it is able to identify the user from the commit operations but not for the workflow triggers. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Workflow Triggers record anonymous users when performing a transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Release column in the plan view shows only one release when the issue might have multiple fix versions. The field is prepared to render and work in only one selection.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Advanced Roadmaps create a plan and add some issues to it
 # Add two fix versions to the issue in Jira 
 # At the plan, reload the information (calculate) and set a different Fix Version
 # Commit the change
 # On Jira, the information was replaced by the new value

h3. Expected Results

All fix versions are shown in the plan in the _Release_ column

The Plan should prompt to select an option to add a new value
h3. Actual Results

Only one fix version is shown
 !Travel_Go_Mobile_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira_and__TSDP-6__epic1_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!

The Plan overwrites the entire field and does not give an option to have multiple values on Fix Version (Release) field
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Release column in the plan view shows only one release

fields.description:
h2. Summary

You can use the basic roadmaps to plan work in a board.

But, currently, the basic roadmaps are designed to support single project only. Which means that you won't be able to have issues from different projects be displayed in the roadmap.
h2. Suggestion

Make it possible to use cross-project roadmaps.
h5.  
h5.  
h5. Original request

Hi,

We are a SW Development firm where Management wants to be able to have an overview of Ongoing projects "EPICs" from multiple projects. Where would this be possible? As I currently only can have Single project when using Roadmap.

{quote}

 # In the *Versions* filter or panel, select one or more versions. Issues belonging to these versions will continue showing, while all other issues will be hidden.{quote}

fields.description:
Today, the Sprint Health Gadget colors are based on the status categories of the board:
 # Blue (To Do) - Consider the status in the first column of the board
 # Yellow (In Progress) - Consider all the status in the columns between the first and the last column of the board
 # Green (Done) - Consider the status in the last column of the board

That being said, if you have multiple statuses in the "In progress" category, all the estimation is displayed together with the same column. 

Please, allow the possibility to add separate colors for each status.

h3. Issue Summary
Changing the due date of an epic in the issue details view does not reflect back on the epic bar shown on the roadmap

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Click on an epic shown on the roadmap to open up the issue details panel
 # Step 2: Update the due date in the issue details panel to a different date and confirm the input

h3. Expected Results
The right end of the bar representing that epic adapts to the date set in the issue details panel

h3. Actual Results
The right end of the bar representing that epic does not change until the page is refreshed

h3. Workaround
* Update the due date by dragging the right end of the bar
fields.summary: Changing the due date of an epic in the roadmap's issue details panel does not update the epic bar

fields.description:
Sorting by updated tickets and going through email notifications is not efficient when trying to see what tickets have been updated and unopened. You should be able to look at a queue and see which have been recently updated with some sort of highlighting, bolding or indicator. It is hard to see which updated tickets have been reviewed by me or not just by looking at a Jira queue. It would be very helpful for the tickets to stand out in a queue indicating it has been updated, but not reviewed yet by whoever is viewing. 

Solarwinds does this. When a ticket is commented on or data is updated, the ticket populates a dot next to it. When you open up the ticket, the dot goes away. So you know if you have reviewed the ticket since last updated.

Gmail also does this. You can tell which emails you have read and which are unread because the emails in your inbox queue changes color.

Google hangouts also does this. I can see which messages I have read and which are new and unread.

Please implement something like this!

Thanks!
fields.summary: Some Indicator that a ticket has been updated and unopened

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This problem is described in the documentation [Unable to assign Priorities to Card Colours in Jira Software Board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unable-to-assign-priorities-to-card-colours-in-jira-software-board-966672912.html]

If there is an incorrect string configured as the status_color value stored in the database for the priority table, the board fails to load when you set the card layout based on the priority.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Jira settings > Issues > Priorities*
# Add a new priority and in the field *Priority Color* set the color name instead of the color hex; "Red" for example
# Access one of your boards and access *Board settings > Card colors*
# Select *Priorities* in *Colors based on*

h3. Expected Results

The priority creation warns you that you're using an invalid value or the board works as expected

h3. Actual Results

The error "Internal Server Error" is displayed

h3. Workaround

# Go to *Jira settings > Issues > Priorities* and adjust the color of the created priority using the [hex code|https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_picker.asp] of the color
fields.summary: Unable to assign Priorities to Card Colours in Jira Software Board

fields.description:
We would like to have more than 14 colors available for the issue color field in JIRA.

Currently, the Issue Color field is locked in Jira. Please allow users to have simple color names like Red, Green, Orange instead of dark orange, light green, etc that are currently in Jira Cloud and add new ones to fit their organization's needs.
fields.summary: Ability to add more colors to Issue Colors field

fields.description:
When export issues from Jira, it adds up the time spent on the task and the original task estimate for all sprints.

For example, the issue "xxx" was associated with the sprint A and B. In the sprint A the time spent was 1h and Sprint B 3h.
The report comes with both sprints and the time spent equal to 4h. 
It would be nice if there is a report that split this time by sprint:
* Issue "xxx" / sprint A / 1h
* Issue "xxx" / sprint B / 3h
fields.summary: Report that split time spent from each sprint.

fields.description:
*Issue Summary:*
 If the manage sprint permission is revoked for a user, he is still able to view, update, and edit all sprint related activities. This is applicable to all users and sprints. There was a similar issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-16719 reported earlier which has been closed now.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 1. Remove the manage sprint permission for a user.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 2. You are still able to see start sprint and able to perform sprint related activities( view, edit, update ).
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

*Expected Results*:
 Users should not be able to view, edit, or update the manage sprint related activities if they do not have the *manage sprint permissions.*

*Actual Results*:
 Users are able to perform sprint related activities without being granted "manage sprint permissions".

*Workaround*
 “Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available”
fields.summary: Manage sprint permissions is not working as expected.

fields.description: It would be nice to add F# code highlighting in comments and description of Jira tickets.
fields.summary: Add F# syntax highlighting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Under Jira Software configuration, create the option "*Relevant sprints*" as we have in Server instances.
h3. Expected Results
 # Log in as a user with the 'Jira Administrators' [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-manage-sprints-permission-for-advanced-cases-938847165.html].
 # Select *Administration* ( !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/951394526/cog_icon.png?version=1&modificationDate=1527598493234&api=v2|width=18! ) > *Applications*, then scroll down the page to the *Jira Software* section.
 # Under *Jira Software configuration*, select the *Relevant sprints* checkbox.

!image-2020-08-26-19-20-58-594.png|width=842,height=372!

Into this documentation, we have more details about the configuration: [Limiting sprint selection to relevant sprints.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/limiting-sprint-selection-to-relevant-sprints-1014679373.html]
fields.summary: Under Jira Software configuration, create the option Relevant sprints as we have in Server
Improve error message from the request POST when a user doesn't have permission to see the project

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Currently, there isn't a REST API endpoint to get the issue type of a specific project.

It would be helpful to get all issue types available into a specific project through a REST API endpoint.

*E.g*.: [https://<Jira_instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/<project_ID>/issuetype|https://fontana.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/10058/issuetype]
fields.summary: Create a REST API to show the issue type available to a specific project

fields.description:
Currently, if we archive a next-gen project, we will still be able to see the board names that are part of the project however you will not be able to access it.

This might cause confusion and in case the project is archived and the board has data from a single project then the name should not be showing up in the list.
fields.summary: Archive project will not archive the board name and it will still show up in the list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clear issues in Done column throws error *Something's gone wrong. Refresh the page and try again*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Can reproduce the issue on the as many times as we want and get the exact same error. It fails to clear the issue from the Done column.

h3. Expected Results

It should clear all the issues in the Done ✅  column

h3. Actual Results

It gives Internal server 500 error

From the HAR file : - 
{\"clearCards\":null}
,\"errors\":[{\"message\":\"Internal server
error\",\"locations\":[

{\"line\":2,\"column\":3}
],\"path\":[\"clearCards\"],\"extensions\":{\"status\":[500],\"statusCode\":500,\"errorType\":null,\"operationName\":\"SoftwareBoardClearCards\",\"tenantId\":\"6ffd50dc-4f35-462e-a0b4-0cc8e7cc6c36\",\"userMessage\":\"Internal
server error\"}}]}"*


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clear issue feature in Done column in a Next-gen project throws Internal server error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trying to create an issue in an epic in roadmaps in classic, or issue detail view child issues, results in creating the issue but it is not linked to the epic. This issue only affects classic software projects, not Next-gen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a required field for the issue type
 # Remove epic link from the full issue create screen
 # Try to create a child issue -> directed to full issue create screen (without epic field)
 # Create issue

h3. Expected Results
Issue created with epic.

h3. Actual Results
Issue created without epic.

h3. Workaround
Add epic link field back to the full issue create screen.

 !Screen Shot 2020-08-25 at 12.14.01.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating issue in epic results in issue created without epic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing Jira Software projects without boards, users are being redirected to blank pages
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Jira Software project and add issues to it
 # Remove all the boards from the project
 # In the opt navigation menu, click on *Projects* and click on the project created in step #1

h3. Expected Results

The *Open issues* quick filter is selected and the open issues are displayed
h3. Actual Results

The *Open issues* quick filter is selected and none of the issues are visible. Also, all the other menu options show a blank page

!Screen Recording 2020-08-24 at 05.02.12 PM.gif|width=890,height=454!
h3. Workaround

Access the issues using the direct link https://<INSTANCENAME>.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/<PROJECTKEY>/issues/
fields.summary: When accessing Jira Software projects without boards, users are being redirected to blank pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It has been noticed that in some customer instances the statuses of certain issues are showing as blank. This is causing errors in the issue display and in modules like roadmaps.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to customer instance.
 # Take an excel import of the issues via the advanced search.
 # Check the issues where the statuses or issue type are showing as blank 
 # Check whether they are showing up correctly in the Jira UI.

h3. Expected Results

Mandatory fields like statuses, issue types, etc should not be blank for an issue.
h3. Actual Results

NA
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The customer has to contact support to make the necessary corrections over the backend.
fields.summary: Some customer issue statuses are showing as blank.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we open a project that has no board associated with it, we are redirected to the project issue search page, however, the panel where the issues should be displayed is blank, we must refresh the page to make the issues appear.

Note: Even if we select a different filter, the panel will continue blank, the issue is only fixed by refreshing the page, select a different filter does not work.

Before refresh
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-21 at 22.46.56.png|thumbnail! 
After refresh
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-21 at 22.47.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Software project.
 # Delete the board that was created with this project.
 # Access the project.
 #* We are redirected to the project issue search, the panel where the issues should be displayed is blank.
 # Select any filter, the issues panel will stay blank, no result is returned.
 # Refresh the page, the issues panel will load the filter data.

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to use the project issue search by accessing the project.

h3. Actual Results
Access a project with no boards lands you to a broken project issue search page.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Access a project with no boards lands you to a broken project issue search page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customers are able to flag an issue in JSW boards (yellow color card is working), but the flag icon is not showing up anymore. 
The same is happening for the days in column functionality. You can enable it, but it is not showing up in the cards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JSW board and try to flag an issue or find the days in column icon

h3. Actual Results
- Only the yellow card is working when you add a flag to an issue

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Days in column and Flag icon are missing in JSW boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Kanban teams show a sum of individual team member weekly hours rather than the default 200 when left empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Kanban team
# Leave the Capacity (weekly hours) empty
# Add 2 members
# Save

 !2020-08-21_11-56-40.gif|width=400&height=200! 

h3. Expected Results

The Capacity should display 200 weekly hours since that is the default when left empty.

h3. Actual Results

The Capacity displays a sum of 40 weekly hours per team member instead of the default 200. Despite this, the Plan's auto-scheduling is still done using 200 weekly hours as its source.

h3. Workaround

Manually add the weekly hours to the weekly Capacity to the appropriate value.
fields.summary: Kanban team shows sum of individual team member weekly hours

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When [Grouping By Teams|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/grouping-by-teams-998651111.html] you get a velocity view per Sprint which displays a capacity bar for the Sprint.

The estimation provided includes both parent and child issues which can be misleading when comparing it to your Classic Software Backlog since the Epic parent would be hidden on the side panel most times.

In the example below, the estimation total is 90 points which includes 50 points from the Epic parent.

 !TST7_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Propose solution

In the capacity bar, include an optional breakdown where users can see where the estimation values are allocated to (Epic, Story, ect...).
fields.summary: Velocity breakdown for estimation when grouping by team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When opening an issue with a long-named field option (about 30 characters), the option name will be truncated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an EPIC with name around 25-30 characters
 # Create an issue under above EPIC
 # Open the issue in New Issue View

h3. Expected Results

Epic Link should show complete name of the EPIC
h3. Actual Results

Epic Link only shows around 20 characters and truncates rest of the characters. Hovering on the Epic Link field also does not show complete name. This makes it inconvenient to figure out which EPIC it is if the names are similar. 

!image-2020-08-20-18-54-00-503.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

This issue also affects a few custom field types, such as Select List.

h3. Workaround

- As of now, the only way Epic Name could be seen completely is through old issue view.
- The workaround *will not work* for custom fields.

!image-2020-08-20-18-54-11-920.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Long field options are truncated in New Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you edit a multiline text field in the old issue view it shows the old data unless we do a browser refresh.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create any issue which has a custom multiline text field.
 # Navigate to the old issue view.
 # Put some value into this text field and click the tick symbol. The new value should show up in the text field. Instead, it still shows the old value.
 # Refresh the browser. The new value will appear in the text field.

h3. Expected Results

The data in the multiline text field should get auto refreshed once we enter the data and click the tick symbol.
h3. Actual Results

The data in the multiline text field is not getting auto refreshed.

h3. Workaround

Refresh the browser.
fields.summary: Editing a multiline text field in old issue view, shows old data unless we do explicit browser refresh.

fields.description:
The Pie chart gadget in the Dashboard starts repeating colours if grouped by , for example "Status".

h3.Steps to replicate:
# Make sure you have 8 Statuses in a workflow for a project.
# Add the Pie chart gadget to an existing dashboard , choose the above project and group by "Status".
The Colours will repeat after 7th status. Please refer image.

h4.Suggestion:
It would be good if there are more colours in the palette for Pie chart gadget so that the repetition is not easily evident. Or any other approach where in this repetition is not evident.
fields.summary: The Pie chart dashboard gadget has limited set of colours and starts repeating if grouped by Status.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Next-gen backlog shows a number of cards greater than 250 cards, the *initial load of the backlog* will be slower.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have next-gen project type and create 250+ issues adding them to the backlog
 # Open Next-gen backlog

h3. Expected Results
Next-gen backlog would *initially load* in a similar time to classic boards with 300 cards

h3. Actual Results
The backlog loads very slow.

h3. Workaround
 # *Reduce number of cards on the backlog*
 # *Switch to Classic projects and migrate issues over*
fields.summary: Backlog with more than 250 issues has room for improvements in terms of performance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking on Rule executions to run a manually triggered rule through the Roadmap, the sidebar gets blank and doesn't load.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a next-gen software project, create a manually triggered automation rule.
 # On a Roadmap, click on the first Epic and click on Rule executions.

h3. Expected Results

It shows the option to select and run the manually triggered rule.
h3. Actual Results

The sidebar shows blank.


If it loads, it's not possible to select the automation.
h3. Workaround

Open the Epic on a new tab and run the automation.
fields.summary: Rule executions not working correctly on Roadmaps (Next-gen)

fields.description:
Currently we don't have a control chart report for next gen projects. Adding this feature to the Next-gen would be helpful.

Edit: 
Cumulative flow diagram for next-gen doesn't represent numbers of cycle time as it does in classic projects.
fields.summary: Control chart report for next gen projects.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Ability to customize the Release Note

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a release note as described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-release-notes-776636314.html

h3. Expected Results
User can customize the contents, like:
* Filter the tickets to show in the release note
* Customize the format of the text

h3. Actual Results
Customization is not possible at the moment.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the Release Note

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer is trying to delete a *subtask* from Next-Gen project and would like to *capture the Parent issue key* from the JSON response.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Webhook with Issue deleted event.
{quote}!Screenshot 2020-08-18 at 7.39.31 PM.png|thumbnail!
{quote}
 # Delete a subtask from any Next gen project.
 # View the JSON response and we would not be able to find the parent issue key
{quote}!Screenshot 2020-08-18 at 7.38.16 PM.png|thumbnail!
{quote}

h3. Expected Results

When the same process is followed for a *Classic project*, we can find the *parent issue key* (*issue.fields.parent.key*) from the *JSON* response *but* for a *Next gen project*, we do not see the Parent issue key in the JSON response.
h3. Actual Results

We are unable to see the Parent issue key and can only find the Subtask issue key in the JSON response.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: REST API should be able to display parent issue key While deleting a subtask from Next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a new issue from an Advanced Roadmap plan (where that issue has a parent or epic link) any automations that rely on that parent link are triggered before the parent/epic link is set
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project and create an automation rule to trigger on issue creation such that the issue is edited and set with the component copied from its epic
 # Create some components in the project
 # Create an epic in the project
 # Edit the epic and assign the components to it
 # Create a plan using the project as an issue source
 # Create a story that is a child of the epic (which should appear in the plan)
 # Review changes and save to Jira

h3. Expected Results

The new issue should *always* end up with the components that are set on it's parent epic.
h3. Actual Results

*Sometimes* the issue has the components from its parent but more often than not it doesn't.
h3. Workaround

Manually set the components or create the issues from within Jira and not a plan.
fields.summary: Creating an issue with a parent does not trigger automation reliant on parent data

fields.description:
It would be good to have an option to remove the “*Story points*” from “*Issue layout*” in order to remove from the *hidden fields panel*.

Even if we follow the steps below, the field continues appearing on the Issue layout under hidden fields panel.
 *  removed the field from “*Applicable contexts*”.
 * removed from the screen associated with the issue type (e.g.: Epic or Story).
fields.summary: Ability to remove the Story point from Issue layout

fields.description: Currently its not possible to configure swimlane on boards based on Initiative issue type. It would be good if users can configure Swimlanes based on issue type which is at the top most level in Advanced roadmap hierarchy.
fields.summary: Swimlane on boards depending upon issue type in top most hierarchy of Advanced roadmaps

fields.description:
Currently in every user story we have "Requirement Status" field. The status of this field depends of the status of the test cases that are related to the user story. The problem is that the test cases can be common for functionality out of the scope of the story. So the test cases are related to many test executions. The "Requirement Status" is updated on every test run, which is confusing and not correct. 

The requirement status of specific user story should depend only to the specific test execution linked to the story, because this execution shows the testing result only in the context of the scope of the story. No matter that the test cases might be linked to many test cases the requirement status shouldn't be affected by the other executions (they might be related to different environment, product, etc.)
fields.summary: User Story requirement status should not update on any test run

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When dragging and dropping a parent issue in the Portfolio 3.0 improved interface will only impact the rank for the issue you moved. The rank for all descendent issues will remain unchanged.

This behaviour used to be the default behaviour in 2.0 but was changed due to feedback (more info: JPOSERVER-2493

*Allow the user to configure between the old ranking behaviour and the new ranking behaviour*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Drag an epic (with children) from the bottom of the plan to the top

h3. Expected Results
 * The child issues of the epic would be ranked to the top when viewing story <-> story.
 * Auto-schedule would consider the child issues as high-priority.

h3. Actual Results
 * All child issues would also be ranked to the top - looking at only the story level issues, the child issues will remain ranked at the bottom
 * Auto-schedule considers these issues last.

h3. Workaround
 # Select the issue and all it's children
 # Select Bulk actions
 # Bulk change 'Rank'
 # Set the new rank for all selected issues in the hierarchy
fields.summary: Ability to change the rank of an issue resulting in all descendents of the issue to also be ranked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Kanban for a plan the estimates of an issue can be consumed from weeks in the past. This is different from the scrum behaviour where all capacity is consumed from the current or future sprint. This presents a problem when the issue goes from a past iteration into a future iteration. 

+_Issue in past sprint does not consume capacity:_+

!Screen Shot 2020-08-14 at 10.25.35 am.png|width=529,height=127!

+_Issue in past iteration week consume capacity:_+

_!Screen Shot 2020-08-14 at 10.24.40 am.png|width=529,height=136!_

The complexity here is whether or not we are the user is reducing the estimate to account for latest estimates. When users log working hours the estimate will be reduced but the capacity is still removed from past sprints. This means that we effectively reduce the remaining capacity twice.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan that uses hour based estimation
 # Create a Kanban team
 # Group the roadmap view by team and show capacity on the timeline
 # Create an issue and give it an estimate 
 # Set the start and end dates of the issue so that it is in a week that is in the past

h3. Expected Results

Capacity should only be taken from the current and future weeks. The issue should not consume capacity from past weeks.
h3. Actual Results

The capacity of weeks in the past is consumed.
h3. Workaround

Reduce the estimate to reflect the time assigned to past weeks (this is not an ideal solution).
fields.summary: Setting an issue in the past on a kanban plan distributes effort into the past

fields.description:
h3. Request Summary

Include the epic name instead of the epic ID when exporting issue with Epic Link field in issue search results.
fields.summary: Include the epic name instead of the epic ID when exporting issue with Epic Link field in issue search results

fields.description: When we write a JQL Advanced search and we hit "tab key" on the keyboard, then it should autocomplete using the first suggestion.
fields.summary: Autocomplete the JQL search through "tab" keyboard

fields.description: At the moment, Teams field value will be inherited from parent tasks to sub-tasks. Provide the ability to assign different teams to parent issues and associated sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Allow different team assignment for parent and subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Plan is using more than 1 issue sources that all share the same Sprints, if the target dates are not provided, future Sprints can appear out of order and won't be scheduled in chronological order.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add multiple issue sources that all share the same Sprints
 # Make sure the target dates are empty so the Plan can pull the Sprint dates instead

h3. Expected Results
The ordering and scheduling should be done in chronological order, taking into account which Sprints were created first along with the Sprint iteration length.

h3. Actual Results

The scheduling is done in random order and sometimes the next coming Sprint can be scheduled last. In the example below, the next coming Sprint 65 is scheduled after 66 and 67.

 !sprint_65_.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprints can appear out of order when multiple issue sources contain the same sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira is unable to resolve bitbucket org name when creating a repository shortcut in Jira software. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to create a repository shortcut with https://bitbucket.org/<org name>/<project repository>
 # Even though the DVCS account is integrated, it still ask to integrate bitbucket account.
However, when creating a repository shortcut with bitbucket UUID https://bitbucket.org/<bitbucket UUID>/<project repository> the shortcut is created successfully. 

h3. Expected Results

As per the instruction mentioned while creating a repository shortcut, the shortcut should be created by using https://bitbucket.org/<org name>/<project repository> which is currently not working.

h3. Actual Results

The repository shortcut is only created when using the bitbucket UUID instead of org name. 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to create a repository shortcut using the bitbucket org name.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We'd like to set an option as default in the field "Linked Issues". Also, we should be able to order by/sort by issue link name by name when appearing on the field linked issues.

h3. Workaround

1. Go to "Gear option".
2. Acess "*Issues*" >> "*Issue linking*". 
3. Then Insert the letter "A_" at the beginning of the issue link that should appear first. For instance: "a_relates to".

Note: we don't figure out another way to change the option order.
fields.summary: Possibility to set an option as default in the field  "Linked Issues"

fields.description:
Using Advanced Roadmaps, when committing changes back to Jira, it may generate hundreds of emails due to the email notification related to the changes.

As Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to disable the email notifications about changes committed to Jira.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to disable the email notifications about changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Auto-scheduling only considers issues with estimates. However, when inter-dependant issues have manually been assigned dates that conflict (i.e. the issue B depends on issue A but issue B has been scheduled to start before issue A has completed) the auto-schedule algorithm does not adjust those dates if the issues do not have estimates.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan
 # Create Issue A
 # Create Issue B
 # Make Issue B depend on Issue A
 # Set start and end dates on both issues so that Issue B is scheduled to start before Issue A is scheduled to end
 # Ensure that no estimates are set on either issue
 # Run auto-schedule

h3. Expected Results

The scheduling algorithm should recognise the dependency and conflicting dates and adjust them accordingly.
h3. Actual Results

The dates for the issues are not changed
h3. Workaround

Add estimates to the issues.
fields.summary: Auto-scheduling on issues with dependency conflicts but no estimates are not rescheduled

fields.description: It's frustrating to always have to enable the epic panel in my next gen project when I want to see epics in the backlog. In the old project it would remember if I had epics (and releases) open or not and keep it that way through views.
fields.summary: Make Epic Panel Toggle Choice Sticky

fields.description: When the Initiative is linked to an Epic, that link is not automatically visible in the Epic. This should be an automatic operation to add the Initiative link to the Epic form and be an optional field that is visible on scrum boards.
fields.summary: Add Initiatives link to Epic form

fields.description: Request the ability to manually add or check box to automatically pull in pre-entered sprint goals onto the Sprint Health Gadget. I've found this gadget has greatly improved sprint performance visibility for all of my teams. However, adding the sprint goals within this gadget on the dashboard would go even further to help keep key business stakeholders informed as what the teams are focused on during the current sprint. Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Add sprint goals to sprint health gadget

fields.description:
As a user, it would be great to have access to the progress bar (percentage of In progress and Done) of subtasks and sotries as a custom field reference, or just a workable field for JQL or Rest API calls.

!image-2020-08-10-11-51-29-372.png|width=657,height=177!

Currently, there is no way of filtering for this value on JQL for report purposes.
fields.summary: Work with sub-task/Story progress bar element

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an IP allowlist is used on github.com, the integration to Jira Cloud does not work anymore, as the IP space that needs to be whitelisted it too large

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Jira Cloud and github.com
 # Add an IP allowlist on github.com (this may only work with a certain subscription level)

h3. Expected Results
The integration should still work

h3. Actual Results
The IP space required by Jira is too large. According to GH support:
{quote}
adding that list to the allow list will not work. Due to the way the JIRA integration interacts in the backend, it is currently not compatible with IP allow lists. We suggest not using IP allow lists when using the JIRA integration.
{quote}

h3. Workaround

The only possible workaround (technically) is to remove the allow list on github. But it defies the purpose.
fields.summary: Github integration does not work when IP allowlist is enabled on github.com

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to import Issues via CSV into Next-gen Projects in Jira, the CSV importer fails to assign the Issues to the defined Issue Types and assigns it to a default Story/Task Issue Type.

h3. Environment

* Next-gen Project
* External System Import

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Prepare a CSV file with the *Issue Type* header with defined values (Epic, Bug, Custom,...)
# Import the CSV file into a Next-gen Project
# In the field mapping step, map the Issue Type field to their respective Issue Types

h3. Expected Results

* Issues are created as the defined Issue Types from the file (Epic, Bug, Custom,...)

h3. Actual Results

All of the Issues are created as a Story or Task *Issue Type* (varies per Project).

h3. Workaround

# Import the CSV file into a Classic Software Project instead
# Move the issues from the Classic Software Project to the Next-gen Project

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
(i) [Migrate From An Agility Project To A Classic Project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-an-agility-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html]
{panel}
fields.summary: CSV imports does not map Issue types for Next-gen

fields.description: Add the card layout customization for the next-gen board with a custom field for example.
fields.summary: Enable the card layout customization in the next gen board

fields.description: Once the custom field is added for the Epic, customer should also have an option to add this custom field on the roadmap, plus, add a progress bar of the new field.
fields.summary: Ability to view the custom fields of Epic as part of Roadmap and to add a progress bar for this field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The field description only accepts this list of code to format the description text: [Markdown list.|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all]

Maybe we can improve this to allow the field Description to create markdown with formatting option in "*Description*" similar to HTML.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table on the description.
 # Try to change the width column with the available [Markdown list.|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] (This is not possible).
 # Try to change the indentation of a column with the available [Markdown list.|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] (This is not possible).

h3. Expected Results

Insert other code to format the table as HTML.
h3. Actual Results

The only markdown is acceptable in the description field.
h3. Workaround

We need to try to format the possible we can using the [Markdown list.|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all]
fields.summary: Allow the field Description to create markdown with formatting option in Description similar to HTML or CSS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
First of all, the next-gen projects don't have a permission scheme. So, if we restrict the permission *View development tools* on a classic software project for a specific group, even a user not belonging to that group, the user will be able to see the *development* field on an issue from a next-gen software project.


 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the development tools integration on a project
 # Edit the permission *view development tools* on the permission scheme of this project for a specific group.
 # Choose a user and to ensure that it's not nested on that group
 # Access a next-gen project and see an issue

h3. Expected Results
https://share.getcloudapp.com/E0unlDJX

h3. Actual Results
https://share.getcloudapp.com/KourLv8W


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Removing view development tool permission is not working for next-gen projects

fields.description:
We created a new Next Gen project and initially started using the subtask ticket type.  After a few sprints' worth of subtask usage, we found it to be confusing and difficult to close out a sprint - ESPECIALLY in the case of a ticket that was moved from a story or task TO a subtask type. 

 

While this isn't a bug ticket - I would like to report that when this happens and you have a sprint defined on a story or task type ticket and move it to a subtask, those field values are maintained internally despite those not being values you can set on a subtask and when you try to close a sprint, there are very unclear errors about the ability to close a sprint due to tickets with old sprints tagged to them only to come to find out the only way to fix it is to move those subtasks back on out to a Task or Story type and clear out the sprint value and then move it BACK to a subtask...and added headache for closing a sprint.

 

At any rate, I would like to suggest you add the ability to disable a ticket type and not delete it entirely.  This would force the move of any open tickets of the disabled ticket type to another ticket type ONLY and all "Released" tickets of this type should be able to remain in this old ticket type.  I just went to disable the subtask notion given its complexity and confusion it causes for us and was told by Jira I can only delete it and I had to force all existing 557 subtask tickets to another type - which then means the parent-child relationship is lost.

 

The alternative here is that at the very least, if disabling is not possible, as part of the deletion and moving to another ticket type that the move process also auto-generates a "Relates to" ticket link from the moved subtask ticket to its original parent.  Losing this linkage is not ideal
fields.summary: Add the ability to disable ticket types without having to change existing tickets of that type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When sharing a Plan which provides a read-only version only accessible via the share link provided, the viewers are able to include any additional fields they like since not of the filtering options are restricted.

h3. Proposed solution

Allow admins to have more control over the shared Plan and customize what can fields can be accessible.
fields.summary: Allow admins to share more control when sharing Plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Version start and release dates are not respecting the date format

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In "General configuration" -> "Advanced settings", set as the following.
** jira.date.picker.java.format: {{yyyy/MM/dd}}
** jira.date.picker.javascript.format: {{%y/%b/%e}}
# Navigate to a classic scrum project and click "Releases" from the sidebar
# Click "Create version"
# Click the "Start Date" box and select a random date

h3. Expected Results
The date is shown in the {{yyyy/MM/dd}} format

h3. Actual Results
The date is shown in {{MM/DD/yyyy}} format

h3. Workaround
None

h3. Notes
This also effects the date picker on the release dialog.
fields.summary: Version start and release dates are not respecting the date format

fields.description:
As a recipient of a Jira issue notification email, I would like to reply to the email to add a comment to the Jira issue.  This should be have like typical service desk applications where ou can have an open Jira ticket and any of the recipients of the 

So for example, I see someone comment on a ticket that I"m a watcher on. I want to add some info to contribute to the discussion.  I should be able to reply to the email notification and have that comment added to the ticket.
fields.summary: Reply to Jira emails to add comments

fields.description:
Information in checklists are lost when cloning issues. 

We clone issues to continue working on them in the next sprint, at present we lose all checklist information when making a clone.
fields.summary: When cloning issues, retain Checklist information

fields.description: When cloning issue I've found I have to manually re-assign the same epic. Cloning retains the labels so why not have the option for epics?
fields.summary: When cloning issues, have an option to retain the linked epic

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When clicking on the 'Create' button, the default project should default to the project/board that is on the screen.  The current behavior is that the default project will be the last board you have opened.

 !image-2020-08-05-23-33-01-844.png|thumbnail! 

So if you open 2 browser tabs, the 1st tab going to project A board and the 2nd tab being the project B board, clicking on the create button in the 1st tab defaults the selected project to project B.  

For a better user experience and consistency, the create windows should always select the project the user is in or the last project the user visited if there is no current active project on the screen.
fields.summary: Issue creation should default to the project on the same screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the scope view, there is no horizontal scrolling meaning that fields or the timeline view will get lost when adding multiple fields to the view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Keep adding fields to the view until the timeline gets pushed away

h3. Expected Results

As more fields get added and the timeline is pushed further to the right of the page, you should be able to scroll horizontally to still view all of the contents present.

h3. Actual Results

 !TST7_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Remove necessary fields from the view or collapse the field so it takes less space.
fields.summary: No horizontal scrolling on the scope view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adjusting the *View settings* to Group by Release, Cross-project releases are grouped separately into different Projects rather than having all Issues grouped under a single Cross-project release swimlane.

 !JPO3_MIXED_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_cpr.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Group the issues under a single Cross-project release rather than grouping them per Project.

 !cpr.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Grouping Cross project releases into a single swimlane
